ACT
241
Scope of the notary public
Notaries public as court commissioners carry out actions and make decisions in probate proceedings in accordance with the court's decision on entrustment and the provisions of this Act.
For important reasons, the court can always deprive the notary public of the further conduct of the probate hearing entrusted to him and conduct the hearing himself or entrust it to another notary public.
Important reasons from paragraph 2 of this article are, for example: inability of the public notary to perform work due to illness or any other reason, obvious neglect of legal obligations by the notary or other important reasons in the judgment of the court.
No appeal is allowed against the court's decision from paragraphs 1 and 2 of this article.
